articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Builders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Builders
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance given by the art group of the builders for overseas projects.
					 Its repertoire included narration and chorus "May of Victory", dance with drums and song "Thunder over Jong Il Peak", comic story "Let's Live Highly Civilized Life" and chorus "May Pyongyang Be in Peace."
					
					 Kim Jong Il said that all the numbers put on the stage fully reflected the unshakable faith, revolutionary optimism and transparent spiritual world of the Korean workers to firmly adhere to the class principle without vacillation despite any storm and stress and take the lead in advancing the socialist cause of Juche. 
					
					 He highly praised the art group members for having staged a splendid performance which is replete with the spirit of the times and truthfully reflects their life and extended thanks to them on behalf of the WPK Central Committee. 
					
					 It was our working class that took the lead in the fierce class struggle for protecting the dignity of the country and the nation and fought, shedding blood and it was again our working class that performed epoch-making miracles and feats by displaying matchless devotion and popular heroism in the building of a new society and socialist construction, he noted, calling upon the working class to play a pioneer's role in creating new culture required by the era of Songun, too.  
					
					 He advanced important tasks to be fulfilled to intensify the mass performing activities.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the NDC, and other senior officials of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean President on Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean President on Friendly Relations with DPRK
						
   Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the DPRK headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to his country at the state guest house of the president on June 4.
					  On the occasion the president said the current visit of a high-level delegation of the DPRK proves the excellent relations of friendship between the two countries.
					
					  Referring to the days of his visit to the DPRK, he said his country attaches importance to boosting friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					  He wished the Korean people under guidance of Kim Jong Il success in their efforts to commemorate with splendor the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean Party Leader and PM on Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean Party Leader and PM on Friendly Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, Friday met the DPRK delegation led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.
					 The general secretary said that the relations between the two parties are the friendly relations which were provided by President Kim Il Sung and President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo.
					
					 He noted that his party is pleased that the Workers' Party of Korea is leading the just cause of its people to victory under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Equatorial Guinea will continue developing the friendly relations with the WPK and the DPRK government in the future, too, he added.
					
					 Ignacio Milan Tang, prime minister of Equatorial Guinea, met with the delegation on the same day. He referred to the fact that the two countries have developed the friendly relations since the independence of Equatorial Guinea.
					
					 Equatorial Guinea sincerely congratulates the Korean people on their achievements made in the efforts to grandly commemorate the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and strive to boost the bilateral relations, he noted.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County, Pyongyang, and his grave in  Mangyongdae on Sunday on the occasion of the 85th anniversary of his death.
					 Seen standing before the statue and the grave were wreaths from Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were senior officials of the party, state and army, officials of the party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, and working people and school youth and children.
					
					 Laid before his statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Then placed there were wreaths in the name of the working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, revolutionary schools, educational institutions and party and power bodies, enterprises, farms, etc.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Hyong Jik, looking back on his revolutionary life and undying feats.
					
					 Wreaths and bouquets were also laid before his statues at 
					
					Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju County, North Phyongan Province, and Junggang County, Jagang Province.

articles.title: Endless Crowd of People Visit Revolutionary Battle Sites, Historic Sites
articles.content:
Endless Crowd of People Visit Revolutionary Battle Sites, Historic Sites 
						
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- 55 years have passed since General Secretary Kim Jong Il started the study tour of revolutionary battle sites, historic sites in the area of Mt. Paektu in June, Juche 45 (1956).
					During the period the sites have been visited by more than 65 million servicepersons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children of more than 65,000 units.
					
					 The visitors had meetings to vow their loyalty and hear impressions of the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas read by them, contests in singing revolutionary songs in chorus while making the march, etc. covering the course associated with the footsteps of anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 Through the march they deeply grasped the transparent spirit of devotedly defending their leader cherished by the fighters and went round revolutionary relics.
					
					 They visited Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu where they went round with deep emotion the mementoes preserved with much care.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating S. Korea's Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating S. Korea's Confrontation with DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- All the patriotic forces at home and abroad should firmly unite under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and launch an all-out offensive to thoroughly frustrate the south Korean puppet forces' anti-reunification and confrontation moves and their intention to ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes this in a by-lined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK has made every possible effort to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve peace and reunification of the country. 
					
					 In view of the situation where the moves of the south Korean conservative authorities to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK have reached the phase which should not be overlooked anymore, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK was entirely just when its spokesman in a statement called for a nationwide all-out offensive to frustrate the foolish anti-reunification action of the "regime" of traitors. 
					
					 It is an urgent requirement of the present reality to bring down the anti-reunification and confrontation-minded "regime." 
					
					 It is quite natural that the group of Lee Myung Bak has become a target of curse and denunciation by the nation for the hideous anti-reunification crimes committed against the country and the  nation over the last more than three years. 
					
					 If this group of traitors is allowed to run riot as it pleases, it will bring nothing but a war to this land. 
					
					 The present reality requires all the fellow countrymen at home and abroad aspiring after national reconciliation and unity and peace and reunification to turn out as one with burning anger at the Lee group of traitors and wipe out all of them. 
					
					 The destiny of the nation cannot be reduced to a plaything for traitors. 
					
					 All those who value the country and the nation and are concerned about the fate of the inter-Korean relations should turn out as one in the just patriotic struggle to bury the anti-reunification and confrontation-minded elements in the graves of history irrespective of idea, political view and ism, urges the article.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Hideous Provocation Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Hideous Provocation Blasted
						
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The General Staff of the Korean People's Army clarified its strong stand to take a thousand-fold revenge upon the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for having committed an unprecedentedly hideous provocation. 
					 The resentment and hatred of the army and people of the DPRK have reached an unbearable phase.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Much upset by the angry public at home and abroad, the south Korean puppet forces are employing sleight of hand to shirk the responsibility for the above-said serious case, describing it as "an individual action" and the like. 
					
					 There is no room in this land for those prime movers of the worst treason committed against the DPRK. The puppet authorities should take steps to severely punish traitor Lee Myung Bak, Kim Kwan Jin, the military boss, and other chief culprits as unanimously demanded by the whole nation. They should apologize for the crimes and give firm assurances against the recurrence of similar provocation. The DPRK will follow their future behavior with high vigilance.
					
					 If the puppet authorities play a cheap trick in anticipation of luck, without carefully reading the statement issued by the General Staff of the KPA, the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK will escalate the military retaliatory action as they had already declared. 
					
					 The KPA never makes an empty talk. The confrontation maniacs who go reckless like a puppy knowing no fear of tiger will have to regret bitterly, warns the commentary.

articles.title: Papers on Development of DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
Papers on Development of DPRK-China Friendship 
						
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's visit to China in May clearly proved the unreserved support, firm solidarity and true relations of cooperation manifested between the two parties and two peoples in boosting the DPRK-China friendship and advancing the cause of socialism and powerfully demonstrated once again the solidarity and might of the traditional bilateral friendship.
					 Papers Sunday observe this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun recalls that President Kim Il Sung and the leaders of the elder generation of China formed the relations of deep comradeship and trust through the joint struggle for independence and socialism against imperialism and provided a brilliant history and tradition of the DPRK-China friendship long ago. 
					
					 The flower garden of the above-said friendship has been brought into fuller bloom generation after generation and century after century. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il paid a series of visits to China in the new century, recording immortal exploits in the history of the DPRK-China friendship. 
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship has developed on a new higher stage under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited China again this year in the wake of his unprecedented two visits to China last year, bringing about a great heyday in the bilateral friendship. 
					
					 His recent visit to China marked a historic event of particular significance in further deepening the friendship, comradeship and trust forged between the top leaders of the two countries and two peoples and bringing about a fresh epochal phase in the unbreakable DPRK-China friendship. 
					
					 It is the intention of the leaders of the two countries and the desire of the two peoples to steadily boost the traditional friendship generation after generation. 
					
					 This year is a significant year marking the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					
					 It is beyond doubt that this will mark an occasion in boosting the DPRK-China friendly relations full of energy and vitality. 
					
					 Minju Joson stresses that the DPRK-China friendship growing strong as the days go by under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries will be invariably carried forward and developed generation after generation.

articles.title: Construction of Jeju Naval Base Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Construction of Jeju Naval Base Opposed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations of women of all social standings held a rally before the site for the project for the Jeju Naval Base on June 1 and issued a declaration opposing the construction project of the puppet military authorities.
					 Protests against their project are being staged across south Korea, the declaration said.
					
					 Jeju Island does not belong to some politicians and the military authorities but to Jeju islanders and they want to see a peaceful and safe society where the future of children is guaranteed, it noted. 
					 It declared that the women would make positive efforts to put an end to the project in positive solidarity with the actions of the Jeju islanders and other people from all walks of life.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Warmongers to Stage Reckless War Maneuvers
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Warmongers to Stage Reckless War Maneuvers 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers are planning to stage combined tactical exercises in Kyonggi Province from June 7 to 10, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 To be involved there are huge aggression forces including various type tanks, armored cars, artillery pieces, trucks, unmanned reconnaissance planes belonging to the First Brigade of the U.S. Second Division and the Second Armored Brigade of the First Corps of the puppet army.
					
					 The warmongers are contemplating forming combined units with armored units of the U.S. forces and the puppet army to stage military exercises.
					
					 Meanwhile, the first division of the puppet army announced that it would stage ground coordinated exercises in Phaju and Koyang cities, Kyonggi Province from June 7 to 9 with civilians, administration officials and policemen involved.

articles.title: US Premeditated Environmental Pollution Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Premeditated Environmental Pollution Blasted in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty on June 1 issued a statement titled "The United States, fully open to the public the truth behind the burial of defoliant, apologize and compensate for it".
					 The statement said that it has been disclosed so far that U.S. forces army buried toxic chemicals including defoliant in their bases in almost all areas including Uijongbu, Osan, Suwon and Kunsan.
					
					 These premeditated state-sponsored crimes committed by the U.S. against all the south Koreans can never be pardoned, the statement noted, and added:
					
					 The cases of the burial of defoliant proved that the U.S. forces are not "guardians of freedom" and "protector of peace" touted by them but the biggest group of criminals in the world.
					
					 It called on all the south Korean people to turn out in actions to probe the truth about the crimes irrespective of class, stratum, age, sex, ism and political view.

articles.title: Investigation into US Forces' Environmental Pollution Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Investigation into US Forces' Environmental Pollution Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Political parties and civic and public organizations in Pusan, south Korea held a press conference on June 1 at which they called for making a thoroughgoing investigation into the environmental pollution by the U.S. forces present in south Korea.
					 In the press conference speakers said that it has been disclosed one after another that the U.S. forces buried defoliant and various other kinds of chemicals not only in their base in Waegwan but in other bases and scrapped even nuclear weapons.
					
					 These facts indicate the serious environmental pollution in the U.S. military bases across south Korea and the military bases to be transferred by the U.S. forces to it, they noted.
					
					 They deplored that the soil and underground water around the dumping ground for the waste thrown by the U.S. forces in Pusan, in particular, are seriously contaminated by heavy metals, varieties of oil and carcinogenic materials, etc., fatally affecting human bodies.
					
					 They demanded the authorities make an immediate investigation into the environmental pollution by the U.S. forces and urge them to own responsibility for it.

articles.title: Actions for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Go on in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Go on in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Actions of south Korean university students for the settlement of the registration fee issue continued on June 2, too.
					 Students affiliated with the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century of south Korea held a candlelight rally in Seoul in solidarity with citizens of all social standings.
					
					 The participants in the rally declared that an early solution to the registration fee issue brooks no further delay.
					
					 They denounced the police for mercilessly walking off students involved in the action on May 29 and strongly demanded the authorities fulfill their commitment to halve the registration fee.
					
					 At the end of the rally the students staged a demonstration in the area of Myongdong.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Army Soldier Commits Suicide
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Army Soldier Commits Suicide
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A soldier of a unit of the puppet army in south Korean Kangwon Province committed suicide on June 2 while on guard duty, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 He committed suicide unable to endure any longer drubbing, physical torture and other inhumane violence.

articles.title: Concord and Unity of Korean Community in Japan Called for
articles.content:
Concord and Unity of Korean Community in Japan Called for
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, a newspaper of Koreans published in Japan, on June 1 carried an article titled "For concord of Korean community in Japan".
					 Five years have passed since the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and the south Korean Residents Association in Japan (Mindan) published the May 17 joint statement calling for joint efforts to achieve national reunification, expand the rights of Koreans in Japan and preserve the national identity, the article said, and continued:
					
					 The joint statement was warmly hailed by many compatriots of all social standings but has not yet been implemented due to the negative attitude of the Central Headquarters of Mindan.
					
					 It urged the Central Headquarters of Mindan to withdraw its stand, go back to the stand taken five years ago and opt for realizing concord of the Korean community in Japan.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Madav Kumar Nepal, leader of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) who is chairman of the Nepali Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, issued a statement on June 1 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The statement extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in the struggle to reunify the country at an early date under the banner of the historic June 15 joint declaration, the October 4 declaration and the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation.
					
					 The Nepali people express expectation and belief that all the Koreans in the north, south and overseas would reunify the country independently and peacefully free from foreign interference in the idea of "By the Korean nation itself" and thus ensure the eternal prosperity of the nation and durable peace on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional and the Bangladeshi newspaper Blits carried special write-ups on the same occasion.

articles.title: Korean People's Outlook on Life Introduced in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Korean People's Outlook on Life Introduced in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi newspaper Blits on May 30 carried an article titled "People living for tomorrow."
					 The slogan "Let Us Live Not Merely for Today But for Tomorrow!" vividly reflects the spiritual world of the Korean people who dedicate every moment of their lives to the happiness of the generations to come, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters of Korea laid down their lives without hesitation to the cause of national liberation, convinced that the younger generation would surely lead a happy life in the liberated country, though they would not be able to enjoy happiness.
					
					 It was in that spirit that the Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world early in the 1950s and carried out the historic task for industrialization in a matter of just 14 years, thus building a socialists state, independent in politics, self-supporting in national economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The DPRK is now bringing about a great surge in the dynamic drive for a decisive turn in building a thriving nation and achieving world-startling signal successes.
					
					 The Korean people regard it as the most worthwhile life to live for the country and nation and tomorrow.
					
					 Their outlook on life is giving a powerful impetus to the development of the country.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported in Ecuador
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung made public a statement on May 29 in support of the decision of the senior officials' meeting of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The statement said that the international solidarity meeting commemorating the centenary of Kim Il Sung's Korea to be held in Pyongyang on the Day of the Sun in 2012 would mark an event of weighty significance.
					
					 Expressing the will to thoroughly implement the above-said decision, the statement extended solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts for the cause of independence against imperialism and socialist construction under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Works Held in South Africa and Guinea
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Works Held in South Africa and Guinea
						
Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Seminars on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's works took place in South Africa and Guinea on May 28 on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the start of his work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Eddie Kekana, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa, made a report at the seminar on Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Organizes and Guides All the Victories of Our People" (Oct. 3, 1990). The reporter said that thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK has developed into the party of President Kim Il Sung, both in name and reality, and an experienced and tested party enjoying absolute support from the Korean people as it goes by the august name of the President.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his work underscored the need to further develop the WPK as a revolutionary party of Juche-type and strengthen the party leadership with main emphasis on the work with man, the reporter stressed.
					
					 Mohamed Diouhe Fofana, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at Kankan University of Guinea, said at a seminar on Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" (June 19, 1997) that his work is commanding full support and sympathy from the people of the countries aspiring after independence and displaying great vitality for its scientific accuracy and truth.
					
					 The Korean people built genuine socialism centered on the popular masses by properly preserving the Juche character and national identity in the revolution and construction, the chairman noted, adding:
					
					 The reality in the DPRK proves that preserving the Juche character and national identity in the revolution and construction is a true way for carving out the destiny of the country and nation.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Vietnam
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Vietnam
						
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Vietnam on May 30.
					 Pham Tat Dong, chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Mexico
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism published in booklet President Kim Il Sung's work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" on May 30.
					  The work, published on May 3 and November 3, Juche 61 (1972), expounds the idea of adhering to the three principles of independence, great national unity and peaceful reunification and realizing the cooperation between the north and the south of Korea.

articles.title: President of LDPJ Labels Naoto Kan Dictator
articles.content:
President of LDPJ Labels Naoto Kan Dictator 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The president of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan in an address made on May 31 strongly censured Prime Minister Naoto Kan.
					 He referred to the fact that the prime minister demanded the Hamaoka Nuclear Power Plant under the Chubu Electric Power Co. stop its operation, etc. calling Naoto Kan dictator.
					
					 The aftermath of his dictatorship is about to affect politics and society, the president noted.

articles.title: Japan's Reckless Moves for Overseas Expansion
articles.content:
Japan's Reckless Moves for Overseas Expansion
						
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities are frantically working to realize their ambition for overseas expansion.
					 As part of them, the Defense Ministry has set up its first full-scale, overseas base in Djibouti situated in the eastern area of Africa to be used by the Japanese Maritime "Self-Defense Force" under the pretext of "fighting piracy".
					
					 There are in the base the headquarters' building, dormitories, P-3C patrol plane maintenance hanger and other military facilities.
					
					 Reporting about this on June 1, the Kyodo News Service said that it is the first time Japan has set up such a full-scale base outside Japan.

articles.title: Liu Yunshan on Implementing Mass line of Party
articles.content:
Liu Yunshan on Implementing Mass line of Party
						
 Beijing, June 3 (KCNA) -- Liu Yunshan, head of the Publicity Department of the Communist Party of China, at round-table talks with students of the ninth-term course for heads of publicity departments of county committees of the CPC, called for implementing its mass line. 
					 He underscored the need to sincerely embody the spirit of the important instruction given by General Secretary Hu Jintao to do work with masses well in the field of ideological and cultural information service, establish a viewpoint on masses, remain true to the masses' stand and deepen the sentiment towards masses.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Refers to Development of Science, Technology
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Refers to Development of Science, Technology
 Beijing, June 3 (KCNA) -- Premier Wen Jiabao, addressing a plenary session of the National Congress of the China Association for Science and Technology (CAST) on May 28, referred to the issue of the nation's development of science and technology. 
					 It is necessary to develop advanced science and technology and train many talented people if China is to grow stronger and proudly rank itself among world nations, he noted, urging broad strata of scientific and technological officials to work hard to make a greater contribution to the scientific and technological development of the country and the modernization drive.

articles.title: Russian FM Rejects Sanctions against Iran
articles.content:
Russian FM Rejects Sanctions against Iran
 Moscow, June 3 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, when interviewed by a news agency on June 2, clarified the stand of his country opposing the unilateral sanctions against Iran.
					 As regards the attempt of the U.S. and the West to slap additional sanctions against Iran under the pretext of its nuclear issue, he stressed that there is no evidence that Iran develops nuclear weapons.
					
					 There is no reason to impose additional sanctions on Iran, he said, adding that such sanctions will do harm to the economic sector of the country.

articles.title: European Countries Plagued with Colon Bacillus of Enterohemorrhage
articles.content:
European Countries Plagued with Colon Bacillus of Enterohemorrhage
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The colon bacillus of enterohemorrhage is rapidly spreading to European countries, arousing deep concern.
					 According to the data available from the WHO, the number of persons infected with colon bacillus reached at least 1,500 in 9 countries of Europe at present, 18 persons died and 470 are suffering from complication as their kidneys are not functioning properly.
					
					 1,150 cases were registered and 15 reported dead in Germany. 
					
					 A woman in her fifties died in Sweden due to colon bacillus.
					
					 Those cases are reported one after another in Denmark, France, U.K., Switzerland and other countries.

articles.title: Academic Seminar on Party History Held in China
articles.content:
Academic Seminar on Party History Held in China 
 Beijing, June 3 (KCNA) -- The Party History Research Center of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, the History Society of the CPC and the Society for the Study of Historic Personalities of the CPC jointly sponsored an academic seminar in the field of party history across the country on May 31 on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the CPC.
					 Present there were experts in the fields of party history, party schools, the army, the Academy of Social Science and higher schools.
					
					 They discussed the successful practice, basic theories and precious experience gained by the CPC while leading the revolution and construction.

articles.title: Notice on Public Servants' Use of E-Passports Issued
articles.content:
Notice on Public Servants' Use of E-Passports Issued
 Beijing, June 3 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China issued a notice on the public servants' use of E-passports on June 1.
					 This kind of passport is valid when traveling various countries and regions of the world.
					
					 The passport will be used from July 1.
